_comment: Created by rreed on 05/01/2017 15:05:22 using v2.7
title: How does five-year breast cancer survival in the UK compare to other countries?
analysis_commentary: Five-year relative survival for breast cancer has been steadily improving in the UK over time, reaching 82% in 2007-2012. However, despite relatively high breast cancer screening coverage in the UK (LINK), when compared to several other OECD countries, the UK continues to lag behind in survival; United States has reached the highest five-year relative survival levels in 2003-2008 (89.3%) and Sweden in 2007-2012 (87.4%).
data_source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, Health Data
